senses.sense_definition: A heavy load that is carried.

examples.text: The donkey struggled to climb the hill with such a heavy <w>burden</w> on its back.
He put down his <w>burden</w> and rested for a moment by the side of the road.

senses.sense_definition: A duty, responsibility, or obligation that causes difficulty, hard work, or expense.

examples.text: In a criminal trial, the <w>burden</w> of proof rests on the prosecution.
She had to bear the financial <w>burden</w> of the family after her father lost his job.

senses.sense_definition: A cause of worry, trouble, or grief that weighs on a person's mind.

examples.text: I do not want to be a <w>burden</w> to my children when I get old.
His illness has become a terrible <w>burden</w> for his parents to manage alone.

senses.sense_definition: The main theme, core idea, or gist of a speech or argument.

examples.text: The <w>burden</w> of his argument was that the company must cut costs immediately.
She listened carefully to understand the <w>burden</w> of the complaint.

senses.sense_definition: The capacity of a vessel to carry cargo, usually measured in tons.

examples.text: The port can accommodate ships of a very large <w>burden</w>.
It was a merchant vessel of three hundred tons <w>burden</w>.

senses.sense_definition: A recurring phrase or theme at the end of each verse in a song or poem.

examples.text: The choir sang the verses, and the audience joined in for the <w>burden</w>.
A melancholy <w>burden</w> repeated throughout the ballad.

senses.sense_definition: The total amount of a harmful substance or organism, such as toxins or parasites, present in a body.

examples.text: The doctor measured the tumor <w>burden</w> to determine the stage of the disease.
Reducing the parasite <w>burden</w> in the herd is essential for animal health.

senses.sense_definition: To load someone or something heavily, either physically or with difficulties and responsibilities.

examples.text: Please do not <w>burden</w> yourself with unnecessary worries about the future.
The company is heavily <w>burdened</w> with debt after the acquisition.
Mr. <w>Burden</w> has lived in this town for fifty years.
The famous artist Chris <w>Burden</w> created many controversial works.

senses.sense_definition: A minor city in Cowley County, Kansas, United States.

examples.text: They stopped in <w>Burden</w> to refuel during their road trip across Kansas.
The population of <w>Burden</w> is quite small.
